com.percussion.xml
Class PSXmlDocumentBuilder

java.lang.Object
  com.percussion.xml.PSXmlDocumentBuilder
Direct Known Subclasses:
PSXmlDocumentBuilder
public class PSXmlDocumentBuilder
extends Object

The PSXmlDocumentBuilder class is used to simplify the creation of an XML document.

Since:
1.0
Version:
1.0
Author:
Tas Giakouminakis

Field Detail

FLAG_ALLOW_NULL

public static final int FLAG_ALLOW_NULL
Flag for allowing null nodes when obtaining its string representation. If this flag is included and the node to convert to string is null, then an empty string is returned. If this flag is not specified and node is null, then IllegalArgumentException is thrown.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_NO_INDENT

public static final int FLAG_NO_INDENT
Flag for controlling the indentation. If this flag is included, the Xml Document will not have indentations.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_OMIT_XML_DECL

public static final int FLAG_OMIT_XML_DECL
Flag for controlling the Xml declaration. If this flag is included, the Xml Document will have Xml declaration.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

FLAG_OMIT_DOC_TYPE

public static final int FLAG_OMIT_DOC_TYPE
Flag for controlling the DocType declaration. If this flag is included, the Xml Document will have DocType declaration.

See Also:
Constant Field Values

createXmlDocument

public static Document createXmlDocument(String name,
                                         URL dtd,
                                         String publicid)
Create a new, empty XML document with a specified DTD reference, or no reference if both the dtd and publicid are null.

Parameters:
name - A qualified name for the document type, also used for the root element name, must never be null.
dtd - A url that references a dtd for this document's system id, may be null.
publicid - A string, may be null that specifies this document's public id.
Returns:
the new XML document, never null

createXmlDocument

public static Document createXmlDocument(InputSource in,
                                         boolean validate,
                                         com.percussion.xml.PSSaxErrorHandler errHandler)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         SAXException
Create an XML document constructed from the specified input source, with custom error handling.

Parameters:
in - the input source to use. May not be null.
validate - true to validate the document
errHandler - The SAX error handler for this document. This form of the method should be used when the error handler need non-standard behavior, or must throw exceptions immediately on error. Note that the PSXSaxErrorHandler is obfuscated, and cannot be used by Extensions. May not be null.
Throws:
IOException - if an I/O error occurs
SAXException - if a parsing error occurs
IllegalArgumentException - if in or errHandler is null

createXmlDocument

public static Document createXmlDocument(String source,
                                         String serverRoot,
                                         Properties properties,
                                         com.percussion.utils.xml.PSProcessServerPageTags serverPageTags,
                                         String encoding,
                                         boolean validate)
                                  throws IOException,
                                         SAXException,
                                         UnsupportedEncodingException
Create an XML document for the supplied source String. If valid properties are supplied, the source will be tidied. If the the XML header and the document entities element are not present, they will be added.

Parameters:
source - the source to create the document from, may be null or empty, in which case an empty document is returned.
serverRoot - the server root for which to add the default entities including server, port and root (e.g. localhost:9992/Rhythmyx), not null or empty.
properties - the tidy properties, if null the source will not be tidied. Otherwise the source will be tidied with the supplied tidy properties, may be empty.
serverPageTags - the configuration used to process the server page tags, may be null in which case server page tags are not processed. This is only used if tidy is enabled.
encoding - the encoding to use for the tidy process, UTF8 is used if null or an empty String is provided. The format is expecetd in Java format.
validate - true to use a validating poarser, false otherwise.
Returns:
the XML document created from the supplied source, never null.
Throws:
IOException - for any I/O error.
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the requested encoding is invalid.
SAXException

getDefaultEntities

public static String getDefaultEntities(String serverRoot)
Add the entity references required by the parser. Since we are always running on the server, the current directory is the server root, and the DTD directory resides immediately below it.

Parameters:
serverRoot - the server root including protocol, server, port and root (e.g. http://localhost:9992/Rhythmyx). This will be used as the suffix on the entity file paths which are of the form '/DTD/basename.ent'. So the end result will be a filename of the form 'root/DTD/basename.ent'. If null or empty is supplied, "." is used.
Returns:
all default entities for the supplied server root, never null or empty.

tidy

public static String tidy(String source,
                          Properties properties,
                          com.percussion.utils.xml.PSProcessServerPageTags serverPageTags,
                          String encoding,
                          String serverRoot)
                   throws UnsupportedEncodingException,
                          IOException
Tidy the source, based on the settings in the supplied tidy properties. Tidy cleans up not well formed HTML to make it parsable to the XML parser. If the supplied source has an XML header, we assume its well formed XML and skip the tidy process.

Parameters:
source - the source HTML as String that needs to be tidied, not null or empty.
properties - the properties that configure tidy, not null, may be empty, in which case the default settings are used.
serverPageTags - the configuration used to process the server page tags, may be null in which case server page tags are not processed. Server page tags define elements such as ASP or JSP tags that are not handled correc with tidy. All elements specified as server page tags will be replaced with a valid HTML comment before tidy is processed and then placed back with the original element after the tidy process.
encoding - the input encoding to use for the tidy process, UTF8 is used if null or an empty String is provided. The Java format is expected. The output string is always UTF8 encoded.
serverRoot - the server root for which to add the default entities including server, port and root (e.g. localhost:9992/Rhythmyx), not null or empty.
Returns:
the tidied String for the supplied source, tidied with the settings supplied in properties, never null.
Throws:
UnsupportedEncodingException - if the requested encoding is invalid.
IOException - for any I/O error.

createErrorDocument

public static Document createErrorDocument(Throwable t,
                                           Locale loc)
Create an error response document using the PSXError format. The definition for this is: 
 <ELEMENT PSXError (message, exceptionClass)> <ELEMENT
 message (#PCDATA)> <ELEMENT exceptionClass (#PCDATA)>
 </PSXError>

Parameters:
t - the exception to report
loc - the locale to use when formatting the error text

createRoot

public static Element createRoot(Document doc,
                                 String rootName)
Calls createRoot(doc, null, rootName)

createRoot

public static Element createRoot(Document doc,
                                 String namespace,
                                 String rootName)
Calls createRoot(doc, namespace, null, rootName)

createRoot

public static Element createRoot(Document doc,
                                 String namespace,
                                 String alias,
                                 String rootName)
Create the root node for an XML document. There can be only one root node for an XML document.

NOTE: 06/07/2004 If the namespace is required, then it is a good idea to have an non-empty alias; otherwise some of the XML serializer may not be able to handle the default namespace, such as the transformer of saxon. This method always adds an namespace equivalent attribute as a workaround for some of the faulty XML serializer, such as the transformer from xalan.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to add the element to, may not be null.
namespace - The namespace to use, may be null or empty to specify no namespace.
alias - The alias to use for the namespace. This is appended onto the element name when creating the element e.g. alias:rootName. Ignored if null or empty.
rootName - the tag name for the root node, may not be null or empty.
Returns:
the root node, never null.

replaceRoot

public static Element replaceRoot(Document doc,
                                  Element newRoot)
                           throws DOMException
Replace the root node in this tree with another node.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to add the element to. May not be null.
newRoot - the new root node. May not be null.
Returns:
the original root node. May be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if doc or newRoot is null
DOMException

Parameters:

newRoot - the new root node. May not be null.
Returns:
the original root node. May be null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if doc or newRoot is null

addElement

public static Element addElement(Document doc,
                                 Element parent,
                                 String namespace,
                                 String alias,
                                 String name,
                                 String value)
Add an element with the specified value as a child of the specified node.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to add the element to May not be null
parent - the node which will be used as the parent of the May not be null new element
namespace - The namespace to use, may be null or empty to specify no namespace.
alias - The alias to use for the namespace. This is appended onto the element name when creating the element e.g. alias:name. Ignored if null or empty.
name - the new element's tag name. May not be null or empty.
value - the new element's value. May be null or empty
Returns:
Never null.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if doc or parent or name is null or name is empty

                                      String namespace,
                                      String alias,

Add an empty element as a child of the specified node.

Parameters:

parent - the node which will be used as the parent of the new element. May not be null.
namespace - The namespace to use, may be null or empty to specify no namespace.
alias - The alias to use for the namespace. This is appended onto the element name when creating the element e.g. alias:name. Ignored if null or empty.
name - the new element's tag name. May not be null or empty.

copyTree

                            Node parent,
                            Node tree)
Copy a tree, rooted at the specified node as a child of the specified tree and node.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to add the node(s) to May not be null
parent - the node which will be used as the parent of the new node(s). May not be null
tree - the node (along with its children) which will be copied into the specified doc, if null then this method returns immediately
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if doc or parent or tree is null

copyTree

public static Node copyTree(Document doc,
                            Node parent,
                            Node tree,
                            boolean bClone)
Copy a tree, rooted at the specified node as a child of the specified tree and node.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to add the node(s) to. May not be null
parent - the node which will be used as the parent of the new node May not be null
tree - the node (along with its children) which will be copied into the specified doc, if null then this method returns null immediately without modification
bClone - if the node should be cloned before adding to the document if true the node is cloned, otherwise not cloned.
Returns:
the reference to the node added to the tree, returns null if the tree to be added is null
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if doc or parent or tree is null

write

public static void write(Document doc,
                         OutputStream out,
                         URL dtd)
                  throws IOException
Deprecated. Call createXmlDocument(String, URL, String) to create a document with a specific DTD instead. Then call the regular write methods, which will include the DOCTYPE reference.

Write the XML document to the specified output stream. If the document does not have document type, it writes the document type with specified dtd.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to be written, may not be null
out - the output stream to write to, may not be null. Caller is responsible to close the stream.
dtd - the url of dtd, may not be null. If the document does not have 'DOCTYPE' element, this dtd is used for adding this element.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any param is invalid.
IOException - if any io error occurs while writting the document.

write

public static void write(Document doc,
                         OutputStream out,
                         String dtdPath)
                  throws IOException
Deprecated. Call createXmlDocument(String, URL, String) to create a document with a specific DTD instead. Then call the regular write methods, which will include the DOCTYPE reference.

Write the XML document to the specified output stream. If the document does not have document type, it writes the document type with specified dtd. Uses rhythmyx standard encoding.

Parameters:
doc - the XML document to be written, may not be null.
out - the output stream to write to, may not be null. Caller is responsible to close the stream.
dtdPath - the path of dtd file, may not be null or empty. If the document does not have 'DOCTYPE' element, this path is used for adding this element.
Throws:
IllegalArgumentException - if any param is invalid.
IOException - if any io error occurs while writting the document.

toString

public static String toString(Node node,
                              int flags)
Returns a string representation of the specified node. The returned string is based on the node type:

Attribute - value of attribute CDATASection - content of the CDATA Section Comment - content of the comment Document - the document tree Element - the Element tree ProcessingInstruction - entire content excluding the target Text - content of the text node

The following node types are currently not supported:

DocumentFragment DocumentType Entity EntityReference Notation

Parameters:
node - the XML node whose string representation is to be obtained, may be null if FLAG_ALLOW_NULL is included in the specified flag. If this flag is not specified and node is null, then IllegalArgumentException is thrown.
flags - optional flags for controlling the string representation of the node, one or more FLAG_XXX values OR'ed together.
Returns:
string representation of the specified node, never null, may be empty if node is null and FLAG_ALLOW_NULL is specified.

toString

public static String toString(Document doc)
Get a string representation of the document.

Parameters:
doc - the document
Returns:
the string representation

toString

public static String toString(Element node)
Get a string representation of the element and its children.

Parameters:
node - the element node
Returns:
the string representation

normalize

public static String normalize(String inStr)
Normalizes the given string by converting crlf or cr to lf (\r\n to \n and \r to \n)

Parameters:
inStr - The string to normalize, may be null.
Returns:
The normalized string, or null if that is passed in.

replaceText

public static Element replaceText(Document parentDoc,
                                  Element elementNode,
                                  String newValue)
Replace all of the TEXT nodes underneath a given element with a single new text node. If the node has markup, it may not be preserved Comments, CDATA sections, and other children of the node are not changed.

Parameters:
parentDoc - the document that the element belongs to. It may not be null.
elementNode - the element to be replaced. It may not be null.
newValue - the string which contains the new value. It may be null, then it has no effect or the value will not be changed.

removeElement

public static void removeElement(Document parentDoc,
                                 Element elementNode)
Deprecated. Use #removeElement(Element) instead

removeElement

public static void removeElement(Element elementNode)
Remove an element from the document. This will also remove all children of the element.

Parameters:
elementNode - the element to remove. It may not be null.

printXmlTree

public static void printXmlTree(Node currentNode,
                                PrintStream stream,
                                String parentIndent)
                         throws IOException
Print the structure of the tree, recursively. Note this routine does not print the contents, only the structure. This is mostly useful for debugging document processors, but may have other uses as well. Normally, the printing will be done on a subset of a document, starting with a specified Node. This Node and any children will be printed.

Parameters:
currentNode - The node to start the print with. It may not be null.
stream - The printstream that will recieve the output. It may not be null.
parentIndent - The string representing the input header. It may be null or empty, then it will be default to 3 spaces.
Throws:
IOException

printXmlTree

public static void printXmlTree(Node currentNode,
                                PrintStream stream)
                         throws IOException
Print the structure of the tree, recursively. Note this routine does not print the contents, only the structure. This is mostly useful for debugging document processors, but may have other uses as well. Normally, the printing will be done on a subset of a document, starting with a specified Node. This Node and any children will be printed.

Parameters:
currentNode - The node to start the print with. It may not be null.
stream - The printstream that will recieve the output. It may not be null.
Throws:
IOException

printXmlTree

public static void printXmlTree(Document doc,
                                PrintStream stream)
                         throws IOException
This routine prints the structure of an entire document (including the document root) to the specified stream. The contents of the elements are not printed, only the structure.

Parameters:
doc - The node to start the print with. It may not be null.
stream - The printstream that will recieve the output. It may not be null.
Throws:
IOException

main

public static void main(String[] argv)
Main method, for debugging and showing sample code. Usage is : -i (INPUT_XML_FILE_PATH) -o (OUTPUT_XML_FILE_PATH)

Parameters:
argv - required, format is: -i (INPUT_XML_FILE_PATH) -o (OUTPUT_XML_FILE_PATH)

printUsage

public static void printUsage()
Prints the usage of this class.
